channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023080773
item.description:
Report X-2023080773

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was placed into a hazmat bag and hazmat spill tote then taken to the hazmat cage at 2:30am to be contained until processing. DescribePack: The metal drum is dented inward and the labeling beneath the dents are miscolored and show signs of saturation from the leaked contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat bag and hazmat spill tote negated the effects of release.

item.title: Report X-2023080756
item.description:
Report X-2023080756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking on when loaded to the van. It was brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found having loose caps and an eroded seal allowing for contents to leak. DescribePack: Cap was loose and seal was eroded so that only the thin plastic remained on top of the hole. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with liner and orientation arrows were observed.

item.title: Report X-2023080754
item.description:
Report X-2023080754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was damaged during preload and placed upside down in a plastic bag and stored in a silver cart under a pile of damages. DescribePack: One of the jugs had a loose cap. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: Outbound admin discovered hazmat and placed it in a black bin and stored it in QA1.

item.title: Report X-2023080626
item.description:
Report X-2023080626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080626 SequenceEvent: Package came to QA wet DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fully regulated package came to QA wet after inspecting package found loose caps on 4/4 bottles of 70% isopropanol alcohol causing leakage to box. 2. X-2023080628 SequenceEvent: Package came to QA wet DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fully regulated package came to QA wet after inspecting package found loose caps on 4/4 bottles of Muriatic Acid causing leakage to box.
